verses.kjv: And it came to pass in the ninth year of his reign, in the tenth month, in the tenth day of the month, that Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came, he, and all his host, against Jerusalem, and pitched against it; and they built forts against it round about.
verses.ct: In the 9th year of Zedekiah's reign, on the 10th day of the 10th month, King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon marched against Jerusalem with his entire army. They set up camp around the city and constructed siege works on every side.

verses.kjv: And the city was besieged unto the eleventh year of king Zedekiah.
verses.ct: The siege lasted until the 11th year of King Zedekiah's reign.

verses.kjv: And on the ninth day of the fourth month the famine prevailed in the city, and there was no bread for the people of the land.
verses.ct: By the 9th day of the 4th month, the famine in the city had become so severe that there was no food left for the people.

verses.kjv: And the city was broken up, and all the men of war fled by night by the way of the gate between two walls, which is by the king’s garden: (now the Chaldees were against the city round about:) and the king went the way toward the plain.
verses.ct: Then the city wall was breached, and all the soldiers escaped during the night through the gate between the two walls near the king's garden, even though the Babylonians had the city surrounded. The king headed toward the Jordan Valley.

verses.kjv: And the army of the Chaldees pursued after the king, and overtook him in the plains of Jericho: and all his army were scattered from him.
verses.ct: But the Babylonian army chased after the king and caught up with him on the plains of Jericho. All his troops scattered and abandoned him.

verses.kjv: So they took the king, and brought him up to the king of Babylon to Riblah; and they gave judgment upon him.
verses.ct: They captured the king and brought him to the king of Babylon at Riblah, where they put him on trial.

verses.kjv: And they slew the sons of Zedekiah before his eyes, and put out the eyes of Zedekiah, and bound him with fetters of brass, and carried him to Babylon.
verses.ct: They killed Zedekiah's sons right in front of him, then gouged out Zedekiah's eyes, bound him with bronze chains, and took him away to Babylon.

verses.kjv: And in the fifth month, on the seventh day of the month, which is the nineteenth year of king Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, came Nebuzaradan, captain of the guard, a servant of the king of Babylon, unto Jerusalem:
verses.ct: On the 7th day of the 5th month, during the 19th year of King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon, Nebuzaradan, the commander of the imperial guard and a servant of the king of Babylon, arrived in Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And he burnt the house of the LORD, and the king’s house, and all the houses of Jerusalem, and every great man’s house burnt he with fire.
verses.ct: He burned down the temple of the LORD, the royal palace, and every house in Jerusalem. Every important building was set on fire.

verses.kjv: And all the army of the Chaldees, that were with the captain of the guard, brake down the walls of Jerusalem round about.
verses.ct: The entire Babylonian army under the commander of the guard tore down the walls surrounding Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: Now the rest of the people that were left in the city, and the fugitives that fell away to the king of Babylon, with the remnant of the multitude, did Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard carry away.
verses.ct: Nebuzaradan, the commander of the guard, carried into exile the rest of the people remaining in the city, those who had deserted to the king of Babylon, and the remaining population.

verses.kjv: But the captain of the guard left of the poor of the land to be vinedressers and husbandmen.
verses.ct: However, the commander of the guard left behind some of the poorest people in the land to tend the vineyards and work the fields.

verses.kjv: And the pillars of brass that were in the house of the LORD, and the bases, and the brasen sea that was in the house of the LORD, did the Chaldees break in pieces, and carried the brass of them to Babylon.
verses.ct: The Babylonians broke apart the bronze pillars in the LORD's temple, along with the movable stands and the large bronze basin, and hauled all the bronze off to Babylon.

verses.kjv: And the pots, and the shovels, and the snuffers, and the spoons, and all the vessels of brass wherewith they ministered, took they away.
verses.ct: They also took the pots, shovels, wick trimmers, dishes, and all the bronze articles that had been used in temple service.

verses.kjv: And the firepans, and the bowls, and such things as were of gold, in gold, and of silver, in silver, the captain of the guard took away.
verses.ct: The commander of the guard also carried off the firepans and the sprinkling bowls — everything made of pure gold and everything made of pure silver.

verses.kjv: The two pillars, one sea, and the bases which Solomon had made for the house of the LORD; the brass of all these vessels was without weight.
verses.ct: The 2 pillars, the large basin, and the movable stands that Solomon had made for the LORD's temple — the bronze from all these items was too heavy to weigh.

verses.kjv: The height of the one pillar was eighteen cubits, and the chapiter upon it was brass: and the height of the chapiter three cubits; and the wreathen work, and pomegranates upon the chapiter round about, all of brass: and like unto these had the second pillar with wreathen work.
verses.ct: Each pillar stood about 27 feet tall. The bronze capital on top of each pillar was about 4 and a half feet high, decorated all around with a network of lattice and bronze pomegranates. The second pillar had identical decorations.

verses.kjv: And the captain of the guard took Seraiah the chief priest, and Zephaniah the second priest, and the three keepers of the door:
verses.ct: The commander of the guard arrested Seraiah the chief priest, Zephaniah the priest next in rank, and the 3 doorkeepers of the temple.

verses.kjv: And out of the city he took an officer that was set over the men of war, and five men of them that were in the king’s presence, which were found in the city, and the principal scribe of the host, which mustered the people of the land, and threescore men of the people of the land that were found in the city:
verses.ct: From the city he also took a military officer who had been in charge of the soldiers, 5 members of the king's personal advisors who were found in the city, the chief secretary of the army commander who was responsible for drafting the people of the land, and 60 ordinary citizens who were discovered in the city.

verses.kjv: And Nebuzaradan captain of the guard took these, and brought them to the king of Babylon to Riblah:
verses.ct: Nebuzaradan, the commander of the guard, took all of them and brought them to the king of Babylon at Riblah.

verses.kjv: And the king of Babylon smote them, and slew them at Riblah in the land of Hamath. So Judah was carried away out of their land.
verses.ct: There at Riblah, in the land of Hamath, the king of Babylon struck them down and killed them. So the people of Judah were taken away from their homeland into exile.

verses.kjv: And as for the people that remained in the land of Judah, whom Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon had left, even over them he made Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, ruler.
verses.ct: Over the people who remained in the land of Judah — those whom King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon had left behind — he appointed Gedaliah son of Ahikam, son of Shaphan, as governor.

verses.kjv: And when all the captains of the armies, they and their men, heard that the king of Babylon had made Gedaliah governor, there came to Gedaliah to Mizpah, even Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, and Johanan the son of Careah, and Seraiah the son of Tanhumeth the Netophathite, and Jaazaniah the son of a Maachathite, they and their men.
verses.ct: When all the military commanders and their troops heard that the king of Babylon had appointed Gedaliah as governor, they came to him at Mizpah. These included Ishmael son of Nethaniah, Johanan son of Careah, Seraiah son of Tanhumeth the Netophathite, and Jaazaniah son of a Maachathite, along with their men.

verses.kjv: And Gedaliah sware to them, and to their men, and said unto them, Fear not to be the servants of the Chaldees: dwell in the land, and serve the king of Babylon; and it shall be well with you.
verses.ct: Gedaliah made an oath to them and their men, telling them, "Don't be afraid to serve under the Babylonians. Settle in the land and serve the king of Babylon, and things will go well for you."

verses.kjv: But it came to pass in the seventh month, that Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, the son of Elishama, of the seed royal, came, and ten men with him, and smote Gedaliah, that he died, and the Jews and the Chaldees that were with him at Mizpah.
verses.ct: But in the 7th month, Ishmael son of Nethaniah, son of Elishama, who was of royal descent, came with 10 men and struck down Gedaliah, killing him along with the Judeans and Babylonians who were with him at Mizpah.

verses.kjv: And all the people, both small and great, and the captains of the armies, arose, and came to Egypt: for they were afraid of the Chaldees.
verses.ct: Then all the people, from the least to the greatest, along with the military commanders, fled to Egypt because they were terrified of the Babylonians.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass in the seven and thirtieth year of the captivity of Jehoiachin king of Judah, in the twelfth month, on the seven and twentieth day of the month, that Evilmerodach king of Babylon in the year that he began to reign did lift up the head of Jehoiachin king of Judah out of prison;
verses.ct: In the 37th year of the exile of King Jehoiachin of Judah, on the 27th day of the 12th month, Evil-merodach became king of Babylon and in that first year of his reign, he released King Jehoiachin of Judah from prison.

verses.kjv: And he spake kindly to him, and set his throne above the throne of the kings that were with him in Babylon;
verses.ct: He spoke kindly to Jehoiachin and gave him a position of honor above the other exiled kings who were in Babylon.

verses.kjv: And changed his prison garments: and he did eat bread continually before him all the days of his life.
verses.ct: Jehoiachin put aside his prison clothes, and for the rest of his life he ate regularly at the king's table.

verses.kjv: And his allowance was a continual allowance given him of the king, a daily rate for every day, all the days of his life.
verses.ct: The king provided him with a regular daily allowance for as long as he lived.
